intro: Gnaphalium populifolium, commonly known as the poplar-leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a soft, fuzzy texture. Gnaphalium populifolium is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
